PCG Autumn Meeting

November 3rd 1999
CLRC Rutherford Appleton Laboratory

The PCG Autumn Meeting will be a discussion forum based around the topic

"Pushing the limits of powder diffraction"

The aim of the meeting is to explore some of the current and future limits of modern powder diffraction methods. Speakers will be asked to address these limits with reference both to successes and failures and to the limits currently reached and probably attainable.

The meeting will be organised in a manner designed to encourage challenging discussion, with short presentations, expert summarisers and provocateurs assisting speakers and audience to explore these limits.

Among the topics we intend to address are:

  • Determination of anisotropic displacement parameters
  • Time-dependent powder diffraction
  • "Parametric" Rietveld refinement
  • Energy dispersive, time-of-flight and area detector methods
  • Refining "large" structures - inorganic and organic
  • The measurement and interpretation of total scattering
  • Microcrystal diffraction makes powder diffraction obsolete

For more information and suggestions of topics, speakers, summarisers (or provocateurs!), please contact the organiser:

Dr C C Wilson
ISIS Facility
CLRC Rutherford Appleton Laboratory
Chilton, Didcot, Oxon OX11 0QX

Tel: 01235 445137

Fax: 01235 445720

email: C.C.Wilson@rl.ac.uk

Further details on the web site: http://www.isis.rl.ac.uk/Crystallography/Pushing99.htm
